cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest and expected to slow, then turn northwest toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana/Mississippi coast)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana or Mississippi coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch and Hurricane Watch extend eastward only to the Alabama/Florida border along the northern Gulf Coast; no watches on the southeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings stretch from Morgan City, LA to Ocean Springs, MS; no warnings for the Florida east coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts expected along the northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana across Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty showers; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤5% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 1–2 inches of rain through Monday, locally 3 inches in squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the southeast Florida beaches.
